name: List
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Table
List
description: Table::List is a special case Array with additional values.

methods.name: next?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Table
List#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of tables.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

tables = bigtable.tables("my-instance")
if tables.next?
  next_tables = tables.next
end

require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

tables = bigtable.tables("my-instance")
if tables.next?
  next_tables = tables.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Table
List#all
methods.description:
Retrieves remaining results by repeatedly invoking #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each result, which is passed as the argument to the block.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method will make repeated API calls until all remaining results are retrieved. (Unlike #each, for example, which merely iterates over the results returned by a single API call.) Use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each instance by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

bigtable.tables("instance-id").all do |table|
  puts table.table_id
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

all_table_ids = bigtable.tables("instance-id").all.map do |table|
  puts table.table_id
end

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each table instance.
